Column Comment.0: LAND REQUEST ID: Unique identifier for the land request.
Column Comment.1: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.2: ADVANCE BOOKING INDICATOR: a yes / no flag indicating request by advancebooking, Alberta Crown request for land sale more than 15 weeks in advance. Mustbe drilling a well adjacent to the lands more than 3000 m deep (every 100 m deepergrants you another 2 weeks advance posting
Column Comment.3: AMI IND: Indicates that land parcel falls within an Area of Mutual Interest, establishedin a land contract.
Column Comment.4: AREA ID: Unique identifier for any named area
Column Comment.5: AREA TYPE: The type of area described, such as country, province, basin, project,business area etc.
Column Comment.6: BID INDICATOR: Indicator set to Y when a bid has been submitted for the requestedparcel. In Canada, a monetary penalty may be imposed if the requesting companyfails to submit a bid on an offering. This information can also be derived through ajointo the LAND SALE BID table.
Column Comment.7: BUSINESS ASSOCIATE: Unique identifier for a business associate, such as aperson, company, regulatory agency, government or consortium.
Column Comment.8: CONTACT BUSINESS ASSOCIATE: the unique identifier for the Business Associatewho is the contact for the land request.
Column Comment.9: CRITICAL DATE: date by which land request must be submitted to government inorder to be included in the next land sale posting.
Column Comment.10: DRILLING PRIORITY INDICATOR: a yes / no flag indicating that drilling priority hasbeen requested. Well drilling to sale - if you are drilling a well adjacent to the lands,you may request priority over the configuration of the posting
Column Comment.11: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.12: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.13: GRANTED RIGHT TYPE: The type of lease right that has been requested by therequestor.
Column Comment.14: GROSS SIZE: Total amount of land measured in hectares/acres in the land requestin terms of working interest.
Column Comment.15: GROSS SIZE OUOM: Usually hectares or acres
Column Comment.16: INVESTIGATOR: Name of the person or group who investigated the posting requestat the receiving location.
Column Comment.17: BUSINESS ASSOCIATE: Unique identifier for a business associate, such as aperson, company, regulatory agency, government or consortium.
Column Comment.18: R LAND REQUEST STATUS: pending, refused, accepted
Column Comment.19: LAND RIGHT ID: Unique Identifier for the land right. A land right is the rights youhave to land, regardless of how obtained. It may be owned outright, rented, aquiredby agreement or contract.
Column Comment.20: LAND RIGHT SUBTYPE: This column is used to enforce the relationship betweenLAND RIGHT and its subtypes. The value must be equal to the name of one of thevalid subtypes: LAND_AGREEMENT, LAND_AGREE_PART, LAND_LEASE,LAND_GRANTED_RIGHT, LAND_UNIT, LAND_UNIT_TRACT or LAND_TITLE.
Column Comment.21: LAND SALE NUMBER: A unique identifier for the land sale
Column Comment.22: LAND SALE OFFERING ID: Unique identifier for the land sale offering.
Column Comment.23: LESSOR REFUSED DATE: Date on which the posting is refused by the lessor
Column Comment.24: BUSINESS ASSOCIATE: Unique identifier for a business associate, such as aperson, company, regulatory agency, government or consortium.
Column Comment.25: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.26: PREVIOUS REQUEST IDENTIFIER: unique identifier for a previous request that isrelated to this request for posting.
Column Comment.27: PURPOSE: Explanation by requester indicating why request was initiated.
Column Comment.28: REFERENCE_NUM: Tracks the original reference number for the request.
Column Comment.29: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.30: REQUESTED SALE DATE: Land sale date requested by the requestor. The actualdate on which the posting is offered may not be the same as the date requested.
Column Comment.31: REQUESTED SALE NAME: The name of the land sale that was requested.
Column Comment.32: REQUESTER: Name of the person who requested the posting at the originatingcompany
Column Comment.33: REQUEST CANCEL DATE: Date on which the request is canceled by the lessor.
Column Comment.34: REQUEST DESCRIPTION: Text description of the posting request.
Column Comment.35: REQUEST RECEIVED DATE: Date on which the request was received by lessor
Column Comment.36: REQUEST SIZE: The total (gross) size of the land request.
Column Comment.38: LAND REQUEST TYPE: The type of request that was made, such as a Call forNominations or a Posting Request. Typically, a Call for Nominations is created by aregulatory agency (in Canada, this is done by Yukon, Nortwest Territory andNunuvit). Industry responds with posting requests; usually the company that createsa posting request is obligated to bid on the resultant land sale offering.
Column Comment.39: RESPONSE DATE: Date lessor responded to the request
Column Comment.40: RESPONSE DESC: Response of the lessor to the request
Column Comment.41: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.42: SUBMITTED DATE: Date on which the request was submitted to the lessor
Column Comment.43: TERM DURATION: Duration which is requested
Column Comment.44: TERM DURATION OUOM: Usually days, months or years.
Column Comment.45: UNIQUE WELL IDENTIFIER: A unique name, code or number designated as theprimary key for this row.
Column Comment.46: WELL LICENSE IDENTIFIER: unique identifier for the well license.
Column Comment.47: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.48: WITHDRAWN DATE: Date on which the request was canceled by the requester.
Column Comment.49: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.50: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.51: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.52: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.53: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.54: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.55: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
